dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3540 IH: Improving Newborn Formula Access for a Nutritious Tomorrow Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Stefanik (for herself and Mr. Turner) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 to change the competitive bidding process for infant formula manufacturers under the special supplemental nutrition program for women, infants, and children, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Improving Newborn Formula Access for a Nutritious Tomorrow Act of 2023 or the INFANT Act of 2023.
Section 17 of the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 (7 U.S.C. 1431) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by amending paragraph (17) to read as follows:

The term competitive bidding means a procurement process under which the Secretary or a State agency selects 2 manufacturers offering the lowest price, as determined by the submission of sealed bids, for a product for which bids are sought for use in the program authorized by this section.
Of the manufacturers described in subparagraph (A), 1 such manufacturer may be designated as the primary manufacturer and 1 such manufacturer may be designated as the secondary manufacturer.

clause.text: by striking primary in the heading and each place it appears and inserting manufacturer;
by striking a contract is awarded and inserting contracts are awarded; and

subparagraph.text: in clause (ii)(I), by striking primary and inserting manufacturer; and

clause.text: by striking first in the heading and each place it appears; and
by striking primary in each place it appears and inserting manufacturer.
